alert.note: Alert for Bollinger; Scott; Stoddard (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 03 at 10:12AM CDT until August 03 at 12:30PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHERN BOLLINGER, SCOTT AND NORTHEASTERN STODDARD COUNTIES... At 1012 AM CDT, trained weather spotters and emergency management reported flash flooding in central and southern Scott County. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sikeston, Advance, Oran, Miner, Benton, Morehouse, Morley, Bell City, Hay-Wood City, Vanduser, Blodgett, Diehlstadt, Zalma and Lambert. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
